Description: Very small fragment of a clay seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration and a very glossy surface. The fragment is flat and shows impressions of a turned string with a width of 0.23cm on the rear. The seal bears a circumferential line and shows small seated lion with its head bent towards its back and parts of a rounded sign above it that is probably a sun disc. The rest is not preserved anymore.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
